title: Riven's Faction should be Ionia now
body:
No more explanation, just read the part 3 of  her nd yas's story

here: https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_SG/story/confessions-of-a-broken-blade-act-3-story/

replies.body:
Totally agree.
She will continue living in Ionia. It is even shown that she found a family in that land to take care of.

It feels like she should become an officially Ionian champion with that story, just like they changed Ziggs to be a Zaunite instead of Piltovian with his comic.

Which would mean the Ionian champion roster would have 19 champions then....
Hell, Riot really should take some years of a break from Ionia.
Agreed

Agreed, Don't worry though, In my opinion (and my prediction/theory) soraka will leave the ionian roaster and will transfer to targon. Making the Ioninian Champs still 18. I also wish that annie's faction would be noxus though, yeah, it clearly stated that she roams into some random houses/travelers but she still never left in that **noxian woods** making her still clearly noxus and in its territory.  Noxus faction just focusing on the main folks in the noxian prime will clearly lose its essence as a faction because it just focuses on the city not the whole faction and its pips.

Disagree.  

 Riven still represents the best of what Noxus is and could be.   Currently she is being _tempered_ and reforged by Ionia.

As a compromise, why not have champions listed by main and sub factions?

Taliyah, for example, is Shurima based but with inklings of Noxus as well as Ionia. Urgot is Zaun-based now but with a birthplace/world view shaped by Noxus. Etc. 

It's also a good jumping point for people to go "Yo why does Kayn have this fucked up world view despite being based in Ionia and trained under Zed? Oh, he's partially from Noxus? Lemme read into this.."

{{champion:163}} *triggering intensifies*

She got taken to Noxus by some representatives who tricked her into thinking that they wanted her to strengthen their walls.  Instead, they paraded her around court parties until she left on the next boat, whose captain promised her adventure but only brought her to the Ionian invasion to be used as a weapon.

Taliyah’s not Noxian.

****

That said, she did learn to weave front Yasuo in Ionia, as reflected in the Ionian robes she wears over her Shuriman tunic.  I’m fine with her being listed as Ionian as well as Shuriman.

She still has ties to Noxus and has had extended interactions with them. If it wasn't for Noxus, she wouldn't have gone to Ionia and she wouldn't have met Yasuo. Plus her time with/in Noxus has greatly characterized both her struggle with authoritarian kingdoms (Hence why she doesn't trust Azir or Xerath) as well as give her a foil to the world of Ionia that she experienced. 

I'm not saying she's Noxian. I'm saying her story has been shaped by Noxus the way multiple waves (Shurima, Noxus and Ionia) shame a stone (Taliyah).

Wait... what?  No...

Azir, Xerath, Nasus, and Renekton were figures from scary bedtime stories Taliyah heard until they turned out to be terrifyingly real.  Speaking of Azir and Xerath specifically, she would have known that both were manipulative, power-hungry egomaniacs who were certainly not to be trusted, especially with power.  Noxus did not make her this way.

Furthermore, she has no ties to Noxus, and her interactions with the faction amounted to being essentially a showroom piece for nobles and then a passenger on a boat before being unceremoniously dumped overboard for not following orders to commit mass murder.  There was no defining struggle with any authoritarian regime—only lies, boredom, and betrayal.

Finally, going to Noxus had nothing to do with providing a foil to her Ionian experiences, either.  She escaped the invasion, barely survived a trek through mountainous wilderness, and then lived a hard life of training in hiding from the authorities under Yasuo’s tutelage.  

Taliyah is not Noxian, or even associated with Noxus.  There is no reason to it on her faction line.

I like this idea

I disagree with your disagreement. You guys have painted Noxus as a meritocracy, and through Riven's merits as a soldier, she got honored and given a fancy weapon by the Grand General. That's very Noxus.

However, after she realizes the betrayal by Noxus when she's sent to a suicide mission to use chemical weapons on the people of Ionia, her representation of Noxus shifts dramatically. No longer is her mindset that of "be the best, get the cookie." It's now "HOLY SHIT, NOXUS IS DOING SOME FUCKED UP SHIT." The fact that she's now seeing the atrocities that Noxus is committing in order to come out on top means she no longer is representing what it is to be Noxus, as she is no longer in agreement with the idea of doing whatever it takes to win.

Noxus sees power, and any means to get to that power. They don't see fairness, justice, and peaceful understanding, at least not as much as Demacia and Ionia do. Noxus, in short, has a distinct lack of respect for those they must remove from their path to the top. Riven is now woke to the world as it operates outside of Noxus, and she's now representing ideals that are not ideals held by Noxus. She is not striving to seek power and rise above everyone and everything around her. She's seeking to atone, foster peace within herself and with the people she has now chosen to live with. She's seeking a more communal way of living that is very much not like the Noxian way of society or living.

So no, Riven does not represent Noxus anymore. That part of her is long gone in her past.

Thank you. <3 All this 'riven should be ionian now' is making me sad. Noxus is way cooler.

*edit* I dont know if you know anything about this. But since your one of the writers I am gonna ask anyhow. I was gonna make a thread but I am gonna throw it all in here. 


Is there any way you can tell me why this paragraph got retconned?

>Counted dead by Noxus, she saw an opportunity to start anew. She shattered her Runic Blade sword, severing ties with the past, and wandered in self-imposed exile - on a quest to seek atonement and a way to save the pure Noxian vision in which she believed.

This was my favorite part of rivens old lore because it spoke of her drive and it made her character make sense. In the new lore it states it like so. 

>Stripped of the faith and conviction that had bolstered her entire life, Riven now wanders Ionia’s battle scarred landscape in self-imposed exile, seeking atonement from those who cannot forgive: the land, the dead, and herself.

I feel ... I dont know how to explain... disconected from the new lore. I cant help but associate riven with the prior lore because this line 'on a quest to seek atonement and a way to save the pure Noxian vision in which she believed.' makes her entire character make sense. Its why she shattered the sword, and also why she keeps it. Its why she refuses to go back, but it also drives her. Before she seemed to have a purpose and a reason to fight. Its frustrating to me that now all she wants (between the lore and the color story) to do is die. It doesnt make sense with some of her quotes. 
'what is broken can be restored'
"Learn from your mistakes."
"My spirit is not lost."

and also the general theme between her passive movement quotes and the quotes which she says while her ult is active and the sword is symbolically and literally restored. 
She talks alot about redemption (or at least thats the theme in her quotes) throughout the game and I feel like this lore is largely missing, or failing to capture, that entire aspect of her character. 

In case you didnt know some of her quote without ult active are these
  "So long I've wandered... "
  "How should I proceed?"
  "My spirit is not lost."
  "Burdens of the past."
  "What conflict awaits?"
  "Choose your own path."
  "My hands are stained."
  "Learn from your mistakes."
  "A sword mirrors its owner."

and with ult they change to these. 
  "I know my purpose."
  "A moment of clarity."
  "Leave doubt behind."
  "No more hesitation."
  "No looking back."

I feel like none of these quotes fit her new lore very well. 

Anyhow. sorry to rant at you a bit. Any insight you could bestow would be appreciated.
I am going to reread the color story and post a thread with my concerns this evening. I will link it too you and /r/rivenmains.

"still represents the best of what Noxus is and could be" im pretty sure a lot of characters (not just champions) fit in this definition... 

* She hates her faction
* She doesnt live there anymore
* She doesnt fit with the current Noxian character profile
* Being born in some place...doesnt make you exclusively from that place (Taric, Annie, Ziggs, Sion etc)
* Also if a place accept you, forgive you and help you to achieve true redemption...now thats what i call home

i dont see logic behind keeping her as a noxian.
unless you have something more planned for her O_o
and in that case...just change her Faction temporaly
Does that mean Riven will likely return to Noxus one day?
Why would she? She was an orphan and the military screwed her royally. She's literally got nothing left in Noxus that would make her want to return.

Now. She got nothing that would make her want to return NOW.
But after spending several years in Ionia, learning more about it's culture & gaining an overall wider view of the world, she might consider going back to the homeland she once love & try to put it on a better path.
Maybe some specific event in the future will reignite her desires to go back to Noxus.

Yes, as she is now, there is no reason for her story to go back to Noxus. But I don't think it's a buried chapter of her life that she will never return to. I believe one day she will, whether she wants to or not.

In other words, I feel like she will return to Noxus one day. Whether you agree or not is your problem.

She never loved her homeland though. She was an orphan there. She used the military to elevate herself to escape from the orphan farm and try to have a better life. She didn't particularly love Noxus because it was never anything to her other than a means to an end.

In her original lore she did love noxus. It was her life. Love is probably the wrong word but she lived it and breathed it. It was everything about their way of life that shaped her. She believed in the purity of the noxus vision even after the barrage from singed. She mourned because of the (what she would have considered to be) sacrilege and her part of it. That is what drove her to shatter her sword, It wasnt a hatred of noxus. It was the deep pain of betrayal and even worse  her part of it. So yes. Assuming the intention behind the new lore was to keep her true  to her roots. She does love noxus, and when she heals a bit she will remember why she fought in the first place.
That may have been her original lore, but it certainly is not her new lore.

IDK. Her lore refers to her noxian military people as her family, brothers and sister which were forged in war. 

>Riven proved a natural soldier. Young as she was, her years of hard labor allowed her to quickly master the weight of a longsword taller than herself. Her new family was forged in the heat of battle, and Riven saw her bond to her brothers- and sisters-in-arms as unbreakable.

And directly before that (I could have structured this better i see) it talks about her life in the noxus military as being her dream. What she wanted to be.

 >She watched conscriptors from regional warbands visiting the farms, year after year, and in them, she saw a chance at the life she dreamed of. When she finally pledged the empire her strength, she knew Noxus would embrace her as the daughter she longed to be.

There is definitely love there. Or at least an idealized version from a young girl. Yes after the fact it's stated that riven hates noxus. However that's largely my issue with her lore.
I think you are downplaying Riven's dedication to Noxus, Darkwill didn't go around handing everyone a fancy runic blade.  Her bio makes it sound like Noxus really did mean quite a bit to her.

the problem i have by this standards is that by this Urgot also should be treated as a Noxian but he gets to be now from zhaun while Riven remains Noxus? Cause the borders are maybe hard to make between these 2 fractions in some point. Noxus old and current stand is that a person can be any role depending on their strenght. There are no noble advantages, the arena and military of noxus is lead by the strenght and not by the many or by the weak (at this point sry for my bad english if it is hard to understand what i wanna to tell). So Urgots philosophy while beeing totaly crazy and probably being dangerous for swain and the now current noxus leadership still resembles around indiviual strenght. Only that he thinks that true strenght comes from chaos and fear. And by that he cleary is closest to Noxus and Zhaun and not like a Demacian who stays for order and a big Union or Ionia and peace with magic.
Riven even said that Noxus no longer is her familiy or country while Urgot is on his way to overthrow noxus with his Idea of the ideal world.
I would say that Urgot remains far more as a Noxian as Riven currently cause she remained threw the whole tribunal and even before while geting arrested and later while people threw fruits on her peacefully, resembling a status that Ionia has tried mostly over their history and a big time over the invasion.
A Noxian would have not wished for his death or to forget their past. Riven is even called the broken blade and i would hardly say that this remains to resemble how noxus wants to be, looking especialy at Darius.
Yes past riven lived a perfect exampel of Noxus Ideal but now she left this war. And her having a magic sword in a magic land is kinda similar to urgot being a crazy guy in a  crazy city: A amtch but not directly the strenght point why any of these 2 should be considered being of this nation. But riven has other points for her saying she fits to ionia and not to noxus while urgot has not realy other points saying he fits to zhaun and not to noxus.

Well one thing i could understand: Rivens lore now is like she quit fighting and is now a farmer girl. While urgot ingame realy fulfills his updated lore Riven ingame is basicly hard to say now: Mostly close before the stories of the last 3 days or while being still ideal to noxus in their army (how you said it) but that would not expalin her ingame broken sword. Otherwise after she broked it down the story says that she soon got picked up and nursed by Shava and asa. So the conclusion would either be that Ingame Riven just doesn't balance quite rightful her current situation or that the story of her is still not finished and she soon will have a reason to at least partly fight again and use the swords power. Cause the only fighting scene we had was the short clash with yasuo and even there she didn't control the windslash of her Sword like she does ingame. But than again it needs to be a realy good point why she should be considered still a noxian and not like a strong ionian warrior similar to irelia.

I don't think you really understand Riven, then, because the Riven here is nothing at all like the Riven we've had until now.

If this was truly the best of what Noxus is and could be, why is she stuck in a suicidal state over perfectly justified killing? The strong survive in Noxus, so why would she feel guilt over defeating the weak in fair combat? In fact, that's why the chemical attack broke her - not just because it killed her buddies, but because it defied that basic rule of Noxus, the strong should prevail over the weak.

To call this new Riven the best of what Noxus is and could be is a rather telling insult to Noxus. Yes, this new Riven should be classed as Ionian. It's happened before, like changing Ziggs from Piltover to Zaun. There isn't a hint of that Noxian idealism we've come to love about Riven in this new Riven's character.

I see where you coming from.

By birth Riven is noxian but in heart she's Ionian. 

Noxians will see her as a traitor with very few seeing her as what noxian's can be (Most likely those who were ill treated like her). Ionian's will see her as an noxian, but what noxian's can be. While other Ionian's may just resent her.

But really, I would consider her an Noxian. While it's possible for Ionian's to win the war and Riven ends up becoming Noxian leader (Queen) and create democratic tides with Ionia as she was in their care.

This however will be a long time before it ever happens and if it ever happens. I can see her denying her right to rule as she might not feel worthy enough.

Only way I see her staying Noxian is if there's rebels in Noxus who joins Riven and Ionian.

Other than that she should be Ionian. People do give up their cizitenship for another or sometimes possesses a dual citizenship. Riven forsaking her Noxus citizenship for Ionia's is most likely the case.

To conclude at this point she no longer represents Noxus,. You need other Noxus champs to band with her for that to be.

Even if she represents the best of what Noxus could be, her actual narrative takes place in Ionia and that probably won't change in the next time or will It?

Is there even the chance of her going back to Noxus trying to change that country back to what it was?
Is there even any _hope_ that something like that could work out?
I mean, we are talking about one of the biggest empires in that world, led by a demon enslaving crow visionary dude and a highly influential group working in the background with the Black Rose.

The story gave the feeling that Riven really hates Noxus, she said herself that she doesn't consider it her home anymore.
She is making connections with the people of Ionia, hell, she found something like an actual family in Ionia, something that she was probably lacking in all these years in Noxus.

And I also thought that she may shift her world view more in the direction of Ionia, trying to find her own peace and no longer looking for superior strength, which is the base idea of Noxus (even the not corrupted one).

>Do I cease to be British just because I live in California? ;-)

If you the option to renounce UK citizenship came up, the situation would be comparable. Because as is, Riven has explicitly given up on Noxus consciously in story.

You cease to be British if you go through the efforts to become a citizen of another nation. For instance, if you leave Great Britain, move to California, and file for citizenship in the USA, you are not longer British, but instead you are now American. You will be an American from Britain, and will always be from Britain, but you are no longer British.
Riven, likewise, will always be from Noxus, but she has shifted her allegiance away from Noxus, who she no longer supports or even wishes to acknowledge as her home, to Ionia. Allegiance isn't your origin, it's your citizenship. Otherwise, Kassadin, Malzahar, and Kai'sa would be Shurima, and not Void.

She doesn't own any allegiance to Ionia and Ionia sees her as a war criminal. Why exactly should she be considered an Ionian? Because she resides in Ionia for her crimes? Her only motive to stay in Ionia is to repay for what she did to Ionia and settle her inner struggles. After she's done, there is no saying what she will do. But who knows the sentence may have been life long so she might serve it for the rest of her life... Still wouldn't make her Ionian... only their slave whether she liked it or not.

{{champion:6}} 
Born in Noxus, then send to Zaun as a **prisoner**.
He escaped the prison and now continues killing chembarons to drive Zaun into insanity (well... _more_ insanity), chaos and anarchy.
So he is pretty much a criminal in Zaun and I don't think you could see him as having allegiance with Zaun. He just is there to show the Zaunites his vision of strength, which he learned in Noxus.

He is still listed as a Zaunite champion.

____________________

Most important for the faction a champion belongs in is not where they are born, if they care for that country in any way or stuff like that. I think it is mostly important _where their narrative takes place_.

Riven is not a factor in the lands of Noxus anymore.
She will live in Ionia, she takes care of these 2 elderly people calling her their daughter.

All her stories from this point on will probably be in Ionia, She has actual impact in Ionia. Not Noxus.

Was the same for Urgot. Noxus was his past, but his business, impact and general narrative is in Zaun, he counts as a Zaunite champion.

Urgot is a Zaunite champion cause he's actively pushing his own agenda in the region and building his own faction which is based in Zaun (Sons of Ur). He is motivated to change Zaun in order to survive and he's comfortable at what he's doing. He doesn't try to fit into Zaun standards, he's changing Zaun to fit his standards. He uses what he got from Noxus and built his own 'success'.
___
Riven is an exile from Noxus who found a place to live but doesn't own allegiance to the nation. Ionia is her home for the time being. She was once a proud noxian after all and has every reason to **fix **her original home (even though the story painted her as hating Noxus). I can't see her inheriting Ionian morals and start living a tranquil life. She can learn from Ionia but I have a feeling her story goes further than Ionia.

More than caring for Ionia, Riven cares about her noxian guilt which is connected to Ionia through the war and corruption she realized her nation brought on Ionia. Her sentence in Ionia is only the beginning of her journey to redeem that guilt.

If she became officially ionian, it would indicate that she has no further motive towards Noxus and would continue her life as a farmer in order to forget her origin. Her stories would go further away from the overarcing story of the world. I mean what possible stories could she have in Ionia? Or rather what would the ultimate goals be?

I think you've very much misread the story about Riven and Yasuo. Riven HATES Noxus and no longer connects with the place she was born. Even in her little bio, it says she was an orphan who grew up farming, and thought the military was her chance for a better life. She worked hard in the military, got commendations and a cool sword from Boram Darkwill, and then had every perception she held shattered when she was sent on a suicide mission to kill peaceful people with chemical weapons.

Riven no longer wants to have anything to do with Noxus. Her past shames her, the people she killed in her mission with Noxus haunt her. Her homeland has completely betrayed her, and she is trying to cut it out of her life. She IS actively trying to learn Ionian, and we see in the story how she is trying to temper her feelings and instinct to go aggressive with the peace and balance taught by Ionia. She's inheriting Ionian morals and practices, and she's trying to become a better person for that reason.

The fact that Riven has tried to atone and return to a peaceful existence in Ionia tells us that she does actually care for Ionia and it's people. She sees her shame whenever she sees the people who have lost loved ones to Noxus. She desperately seeks their forgiveness to help her come to terms and move past her horrible past. She has guilt she's trying to get rid of, yes, but judging by her connection to Asa and Shava Konte, who have taken her in and call her daughter, despite her horrible past, she has found a place she wants to call home. She loves Asa and Shava, and wants to protect them and live with them as the family she's always wanted and needed. She doesn't want to partake in war anymore, she wants to help the village and live a peaceful life with a family.

And you're right, becoming Ionian would mean she has no further motives toward Noxus. This is true because she _does not_ have any further motives towards Noxus. She aims to forget it and live in peace. Her story _doesn't need_ to tie into the overarching story of the world, because not every person in a story has to be neatly tied and bound up in the massive saga. Some characters can be content to have their moment, and live a peaceful life until threatened. That is what Riven wants. That is her ultimate goal. Why does she need to have something more than that?

She hates what Noxus has become and realized that only after she got betrayed. Why would she fight alongside Noxus in the first place if she hated it. Noxus was her home.

All the effort she puts into forgetting Noxus and learning Ionia is just a way for her to escape her origin due to blaming herself for the crimes of the corrupted Noxus. Her being noxian has little to do with how corrupted the nation is. If she had a chance to repair Noxus, I think she would take it. Maybe it is too big of a step to take on Noxus and try to fell it but I doubt she will just forget what Noxus did to her and what it has become. Karma is a b*tch and I'm sure Riven will play a part in the eventual fall of Noxus (if the lore ever allows that). If she gets the trust of Ionians, she could potentially rally a powerful ally against the corrupted Noxus.

You're just ignorant if you think she's just gonna forget Noxus. For the time being that might be correct while she's serving her sentence and learning Ionia. But after that she's probably gotta deal with her roots.

Well this is basically just theorycrafting. Maybe she will stay in Ionia and continue her exciting farming duties until the end.

Nothing in Riven's story or bio leads us to believe that she ever wants to return to Noxus. She only fought for Noxus because, being an orphan, she saw the military as a means to get out of the farm life and become part of a community that would love her and see her as one of their own. She didn't join the military because she loved Noxus. She joined because she wanted a place to be accepted. From her stories, she's never really adhered to the ideals of Noxus and been disillusioned in the same way that Darius and Draven are. She doesn't love the state of Noxus, she only loves that her place as an honored military member gave her a community and a family of fellow soldiers that she could bond with.

When she sees the atrocities of war that Noxus was willing to do to extinguish Ionia, she breaks her ties to it, and all of her lore states that she's tried desperately to sever herself from Noxus as a means to try to ease her troubled mind about her past with them. In no way do we see her as someone who's main intention is to go back to the place they were born in order to root out the corruption there. That isn't Riven, and it's nowhere in any of the lore about her.

Riven's motivations are much simpler than people are willing to acknowledge. She's not a renegade. She's not Robin Hood. She doesn't have grand ambitions to purge Noxus of corruption. All she wants is to be accepted, and live a simple life with people who will love her and whom she can love back. That is the motivation we get from Riven. Noxus was a tool that she thought would get her to that kind of life. It didn't happen in Noxus, but it did when it led her to Ionia. 

People abandon their roots all the time - don't forget that. Not every person has this die-hard urge to go back home. Some people want to make new roots wherever they will be happy. Riven is one of those people, because honestly, she's got nothing back home. She's an orphan, all she had was the farm she was raised on and the military that betrayed her.
